references.paper_title: Spectrally-truncated kernel ridge regression and its free lunch
references.reason: This paper introduces the spectrally truncated kernel ridge regression, a method to address the saturation effect and improve learning rates in kernel methods.
This paper introduces the concept of local Rademacher complexity, a crucial tool for analyzing the generalization performance of machine learning algorithms.

references.paper_title: Optimal rates for the regularized least-squares algorithm
references.reason: This paper establishes optimal learning rates for the regularized least-squares algorithm, providing a benchmark for analyzing the performance of other kernel methods.

references.paper_title: Generalization error rates in kernel regression: The crossover from the noiseless to noisy regime
references.reason: This paper analyzes the generalization error of kernel regression under various noise conditions, offering a more complete understanding of kernel methods.

references.paper_title: Randomized sketches for kernels: Fast and optimal nonparametric regression
references.reason: This paper introduces randomized sketching techniques for efficient kernel regression, which can speed up kernel methods substantially.
